newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BELGIUM TO CHANGE TAX DISPUTE APPEAL LAWS.
newsitem.headline: BELGIUM TO CHANGE TAX DISPUTE APPEAL LAWS.

text.p: The Belgian government said on Friday it plans to change the law that allows a person or firm with a complaint about tax treatment to appeal directly to the Finance Minister.
Finance Minister Philippe Maystadt said the change would initially apply only to cases concerning value added tax and direct contributions.
It did not, he said, apply to cases such as the Kredietbank affair, which concerned bourse tax and was therefore dealt with under a different article of the tax code.
However, he said there was no reason why the logic that was behind the change in the law should not be applied equally to other taxes.

In place of being allowed to appeal direct to the minister, people with a complaint would first address themselves to the person in charge of their case and then, if necessary to a tribunal, Maystadt said.
